instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dont turn on
threads.message:
hello, got this machine as liquid spill around the battery connector



the board dont looked nasty or something like that , only on the battery connector on battery side the markers are red and that one on the left top corner of the board, on that side where battery connector is


after press power button comes the red battery on the sceen, hats all.

i connected a good battery and it is working and charging , everything fine.

so i cleaned the board only with alcohol and set it back in the unit. after that it dont turn on. i heated with 100 grad celsius the area of the battery connector, after that it turn on one time.

now it dont turn on. no green light

i found 2 wholes in <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, replaced that,

at first i found F7005 blown, after replaceing and blown again i found <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> are bad, replaced now.

now i have almost back my green/orange light.

but only 12.20V on L7130

so i checked the SDA and SCL lines of the smc, SDA line has 3.3V changing on oszyloscope it shows trafic

on the SCL line are only 1.7V, resistor ok and before resistor are 3.3V


the lines both have in diode mode somthing of .487

so i replaced <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> ad have now on SCL 3.03 V but in oszyloscope only a flat line.

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

replacing SMC needfull? or some other ideas? need help please

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dont turn on
threads.message: SMC or ISL are dead. ISL has been replaced so that leaves the SMC. Make sure there is no corrosion under the battery connector that can destroy another SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dont turn on
threads.message:
thanks duke.

so would that a good idea for testing to lift off the ISL and check the i2c lines on the smc with the scope? ar that would be working without ISL?

the ISL was replaced before replacing <DIODE>D7050</DIODE>, could be damaged again?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dont turn on
threads.message: Nah, if you believe the ISL and <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> are ok then there is only 1 option left and that is the SMC. Again make sure there is no crap under the battery connector!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dont turn on
threads.message: ok, thanks. so i ordered now 2 junk boards in the hope one of them have a good smc and i will report back in about 2 weeks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dont turn on
threads.message:
so back on work with this board.

i replaced the smc from the donar board and now it is working good. i2c is comunicating, L7130 has 12.54V now.

i replaced the accu to be shure that it will not fail again.

SOLVED, thanks duke for your help.
